intro: Your task is to conduct a pressure area check on Mr Arden who is immobile and at risk of pressure ulcers. He questions the need for frequent checks. Explain the importance, identify and treat any sore spots, and ensure his safety and comfort.
description_html:
In this scenario, you will practice conducting pressure area checks on an immobile resident. You must explain the importance of these checks while identifying and treating any concerns.

Learning objectives:

  • Explain the purpose of pressure area checks
  • Identify common pressure points
  • Apply barrier cream appropriately
  • Reposition residents safely
  • Recognize early signs of pressure damage

resident.name: Mr Arden
goals: confirm knee pain managed by nurse
must_disclose: previous pain in knee managed with medication
refusals: reluctant to move position due to discomfort

safety.if_red_flag_then: explain need for repositioning, treat sore spots, escalate if ulcers suspected

actions.title: Check pressure points
actions.prompt: You carefully inspect Mr Arden's elbows, heels, and other pressure points for any signs of redness or soreness.

actions.title: Apply barrier cream
actions.prompt: You gently apply protective barrier cream to Mr Arden's sore elbows to help prevent further skin breakdown.

actions.title: Reposition resident
actions.prompt: You help Mr Arden shift his position slightly to relieve pressure on his current contact points.

actions.title: Place call bell
actions.prompt: You ensure the call bell is within easy reach so Mr Arden can summon help if he becomes uncomfortable.

actions.title: Adjust pillows
actions.prompt: You adjust the pillows to provide better support and help distribute pressure more evenly.
